topic: People (A Family Member You Are Proud Of)

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a family member who you are proud of. You should say:
Who this person is
When this happened
What this person did
And explain why you felt proud.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
To commence, I wish to describe my father, who is undoubtedly the most Diligent [勤奋的] and Accomplished [成功的] person I know. He works incredibly hard every day to support my studies and future, which is truly Inspiring [鼓舞人心的] to me. Since he is deeply Devoted [忠诚的] to our family, he is always Considerate [体贴的] of my feelings, although he can be quite strict about my school grades. He is Selfless [无私的] in his actions and truly has A heart of gold [心地善良]. He is Generous [慷慨的] with his limited free time and is always willing to Go the extra mile [加倍努力] to help me with difficult math problems. I Look up to [敬仰] him greatly.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Who: Mother / Grandfather
- When: Last year / Childhood
- What: Helping / Working
- Why: Kind / Strong

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a family member who has achieved something great. You should say:
Who the person is
What the achievement was
How they achieved it
And explain how their achievement influenced you.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I have chosen to discuss my cousin, who is a highly Accomplished [成功的] pianist in our city. Her Diligent [勤奋的] daily practice routine is very Inspiring [鼓舞人心的] to me as a student. Even though she is extremely busy with concerts, she is Generous [慷慨的] enough to teach me piano, which clearly shows she has A heart of gold [心地善良]. She is Devoted [忠诚的] to her art but always remains Considerate [体贴的] of her neighbors' need for quiet. She is Selfless [无私的] in sharing her success with others. I Look up to [敬仰] her ability to Go the extra mile [加倍努力] for musical perfection.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Who: Uncle / Sister
- What: Sport / Business
- How: Practice / Study
- Impact: Happy / Rich

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a family member you admire for their personality. You should say:
Who this person is
What kind of personality they have
How they treat others
And explain why you admire their character.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I wish to describe my grandmother, who is an incredibly Considerate [体贴的] and Selfless [无私的] woman. She is completely Devoted [忠诚的] to taking care of us every single day. Because she has A heart of gold [心地善良], she is always Generous [慷慨的] with her delicious food, whereas others might save it for themselves. Her life story is Inspiring [鼓舞人心的] because she was Diligent [勤奋的] and became Accomplished [成功的] despite growing up in extreme poverty. I Look up to [敬仰] her inner strength. She always tries to Go the extra mile [加倍努力] to make sure I am happy and full.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Who: Father / Cousin
- Personality: Funny / Calm
- Treatment: Nice / Fair
- Why: Love / Respect

l2_part3_questions.question: What would children do to make their parents proud?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] It is my firm belief that children can make their parents proud by becoming independent and accepting their parents' Guidance [指导]. [Reason] Parents spend years trying to Instill [灌输] good values and morals in us, so seeing us succeed on our own is their greatest reward. [Example] Unless we show respect for their efforts by living responsibly, we cannot maintain lasting family peace or make them truly happy.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Focus on education. Reason: Good grades lead to better opportunities. Example: Getting into a top university.
Opinion: Help with household duties. Reason: Shows responsibility and care. Example: Cooking dinner or cleaning without being asked.
Opinion: Display good manners. Reason: Reflects well on upbringing. Example: Being polite to neighbors and elders.

l2_part3_questions.question: What did you do to make your parents proud when you were young?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] Personally, I strove to keep Harmony [和谐] at home by being responsible and studying hard. [Reason] My father was the main Breadwinner [养家糊口的人] and worked very long hours for us, so I didn't want to cause him any extra stress. [Example] Since he was often tired, I did chores to help him relax and feel proud of my maturity.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Won a competition. Reason: Validated their support and investment. Example: First prize in a school art contest.
Opinion: Saved pocket money. Reason: Demonstrated financial maturity. Example: Bought them a small anniversary gift.
Opinion: Learned a new skill. Reason: Showed dedication and talent. Example: Playing a song on the piano for guests.

l2_part3_questions.question: What advantages of yours make you proud?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] I take great pride in my unique Perspective [观点/视角] on life and my optimism. [Reason] I tend to Appreciate [感激/欣赏] small things that other people might miss, which helps me stay happy during difficult times. [Example] Although I am still young, I think deeply about the world around me and try to find the positive side of every situation.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Patience. Reason: Helps resolve conflicts calmly. Example: Teaching a younger sibling with homework.
Opinion: Creativity. Reason: Allows for unique problem solving. Example: Finding a new way to organize a messy room.
Opinion: Empathy. Reason: Builds strong relationships. Example: Listening to a friend who is sad.

l2_part3_questions.question: When was the last time that you felt proud of yourself?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] A moment of immense pride occurred when I successfully bridged a Generation gap [代沟] with my grandma. [Reason] We disagreed on gaming, but I explained it patiently to her until she understood my hobby. [Example] Provided that we communicate openly, we can understand each other's different views and maintain a loving relationship despite our age difference.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Finished a difficult project. Reason: Overcame procrastination and doubt. Example: Completing a 5000-word essay on time.
Opinion: Helped a stranger. Reason: Acted with kindness without reward. Example: Helping a tourist find their way.
Opinion: Faced a fear. Reason: Stepped out of comfort zone. Example: Giving a speech in front of the class.

l2_part3_questions.question: How does family pride contribute to the stability of a society?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] Inherently, family pride ensures people act responsibly and care for their reputation in public. [Reason] As they say, The apple doesn't fall far from the tree [有其父必有其子], meaning children reflect their parents' behavior. [Example] When parents set a good example, children usually follow suit in society, which reduces crime and increases overall stability.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Promotes law-abiding behavior. Reason: Fear of shaming the family name. Example: Lower juvenile delinquency rates.
Opinion: Creates support networks. Reason: Less reliance on state welfare. Example: Families caring for their own elderly.
Opinion: Transmits moral values. Reason: Creates better citizens. Example: Teaching honesty and respect at home.

l2_part3_questions.question: Do you think the definition of "success" within families has changed between the past and the present?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] Unquestionably, in contemporary society success is about happiness, not just money or status. [Reason] We want our Flesh and blood [骨肉/亲人] to be mentally healthy and safe rather than just rich. [Example] Whereas in the past parents wanted us to Follow in someone's footsteps [继承衣钵], now they let us choose our own path.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Shift from wealth to well-being. Reason: Mental health is prioritized more now. Example: Parents accepting lower-paying but happier jobs for kids.
Opinion: Focus on individual choice. Reason: Less pressure to follow tradition. Example: Choosing art over law or medicine.
Opinion: Smaller family success. Reason: Quality of life over number of children. Example: Investing more in one child's education.
